wikipedia_page.main: Cheavon Clarke (also named Cheavan Clarke, born 14 December 1990) is a Jamaican-born British amateur boxer who is affiliated with Gravesham ABC.He competed for Jamaica in the 2014 Commonwealth Games. After that he changed his allegiance to Great Britain / England, then went on to win a silver medal in the 2017 European Championships.In May 2019, Clarke was selected to compete at the 2019 European Games in Minsk, Belarus. He also competed at the 2019 World Championships in Yekaterinburg, Russia, where he lost by unanimous decision to Muslim Gadzhimagomedov in the quarterfinals.

response: *Cheavon Clarke, boxer, European Championships and Commonwealth Games medalist

response: After training on and off as a youngster, Smith began to take boxing seriously at the age of 16. During a career in which he compiled a record of 32–11 while representing Poole ABC, he fought in several ABA Championships, reaching the finals in 2013 and 2016; losing out to Jack Massey at 86kg and Cheavon Clarke at 91kg respectively.

In 2017, he won a bronze medal at the European Championships in Kharkiv after losing his semi-final bout to Englishman Cheavon Clarke. This qualified him for another appearance at the World Championships five months later, although he lost in his second bout. In 2018, Korving defeated two-time European Championship silver medalist and international teammate Peter Müllenberg in the finals of the Senior National Championships. He repeated this feat the following year, decisioning Kilat Hallie for his fourth consecutive national heavyweight title.
